sen.j: 藤原 不比等（ふじわら の ふひと、 皇極天皇5年（659年）- 養老4年8月3日 (旧暦)（720年9月13日））は、飛鳥時代から奈良時代初期にかけての公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Fuhito (659 - September 13, 720) was a Kugyo (high court noble) who lived from the Asuka Period through the early Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Fuhito (659 - September 13, 720) was a Kugyo (high court noble) who lived from the Asuka Period through the early Nara Period.

sen.j: 天智天皇の寵臣。
sen.e: Fuhito was a favorite retainer of Emperor Tenchi.
Fuhito was a favorite retainer of Emperor Tenchi.
Fuhito was a favorite retainer of Emperor Tenchi.

sen.e: In historical materials including 'Kofuku-ji Engi' (origin of Kofuku-ji Temple), 'Okagami' (The Great Mirror) and 'Sonpi Bunmyaku' (Bloodlines of Noble and Base), Fuhito was referred to as an 'illegitimate child' of Emperor Tenchi.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 藤原不比等は、天智天皇から藤原氏の姓を賜った藤原鎌足の子である。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Fuhito was a child of FUJIWARA no Kamatari who was given the family name of FUJIWARA from Emperor Tenchi.
FUJIWARA no Fuhito was a child of FUJIWARA no Kamatari who received the family name of FUJIWARA from the Emperor Tenchi.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正ならびに天皇の前に定冠詞を付けました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Fuhito was a child of FUJIWARA no Kamatari who received the family name of FUJIWARA from the Emperor Tenchi.

sen.j: 文武天皇2年（698年）には、不比等の子孫のみが藤原氏を名乗り、太政官の官職に就くことができるとされた。
sen.e: In 698, it was decided that only the direct descendants of Fuhito could succeed to the FUJIWARA clan and hold the post of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
In 698, it was decided that only the direct descendants of Fuhito would have the right to succeed the FUJIWARA clan and hold the post of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: In 698, it was decided that only the direct descendants of Fuhito would have the right to succeed the FUJIWARA clan and hold the post of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 不比等以外の鎌足の子は、鎌足の元の姓である中臣氏とされ、神祇官として祭祀のみを担当することと明確に分けられた。
sen.e: Other sons of Kamatari except Fuhito succeeded to the NAKATOMI clan, an original family name of Kamatari, and assigned to a job of a religious service as Jingikan (an officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony), completely differentiating them from Fuhito.

Kamatari's other sons succeeded the NAKATOMI clan, an original family name of Kamatari, and were assigned to religious service as Jingikan (an officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony), treated quite differently from Fuhito.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Kamatari's other sons succeeded the NAKATOMI clan, an original family name of Kamatari, and were assigned to religious service as Jingikan (an officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony), treated quite differently from Fuhito.

sen.j: このため、不比等が藤原氏の実質的な家祖と解することもできる。
sen.e: Therefore, it is reasonable to think that Fuhito founded the FUJIWARA clan.
It is therefore not an overstatement to say that Fuhito founded the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: It is therefore not an overstatement to say that Fuhito founded the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 不比等という名前は「他に比べることができるものがいない程優れている」というような意味である。
sen.e: The name 'Fuhito' means 'incomparably better than other people'.
The name 'Fuhito' means 'incomparably better than other people'.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 11歳の時、父鎌足が死去。
sen.e: His father, Kamatari, died when Fuhito was 11 years old.
His father, Kamatari, died when Fuhito was 11 years old.
His father, Kamatari, died when Fuhito was 11 years old.

sen.j: 父の生前の関係から、近江朝に近い立場にいたが、壬申の乱の時は、数えで13歳であったために何の関与もせず、近江朝に対する処罰の対象にも天武天皇朝に対する功績の対象にも入らなかった。
sen.e: Although Fuhito had a close relationship with the Omi Imperial Court as his father had done, Fuhito did not take any side during the Jinshin War (a war over succession to the imperial throne between Prince Otomo and Prince Oama) as he was only 12 years old, and therefore, he did not receive any punishment from the Omi Imperial Court (Prince Otomo) or any compensation from the opposing Tenmu Imperial Court (Prince Oama).

Although Fuhito, like his father, had a close relationship with the Omi Imperial Court, he, not having taken any side during the Jinshin War (a war over succession to the imperial throne between the Prince Otomo and the Prince Oama) because of his age (13th year), did not receive any punishment from the Omi Imperial Court (the Prince Otomo) or any reward from the opposing the Tenmu Imperial Court (the Prince Oama).
sen.cmt: ・翻訳では「満12才」と表現していますが、誕生日の後の出来事だった可能性もあるので、原文通りとしました。・「天武天皇朝に対する功績」を「功績に対する補償」と訳していますが、「功績に対する恩賞」と解すべきなので修正しました。
sen.e: Although Fuhito, like his father, had a close relationship with the Omi Imperial Court, he, not having taken any side during the Jinshin War (a war over succession to the imperial throne between the Prince Otomo and the Prince Oama) because of his age (13th year), did not receive any punishment from the Omi Imperial Court (the Prince Otomo) or any reward from the opposing the Tenmu Imperial Court (the Prince Oama).

sen.j: だが、中臣金をはじめとする鎌足の同族（中臣氏）の有力者が近江朝の要人として処罰を受けたこともあって、天武朝の時代には中臣（藤原）氏は朝廷の中枢から一掃された形となった。
sen.e: However, as some officials, who were from the same clan (the NAKATOMI clan) as Kamatari and influential in the Omi Imperial Court such as NAKATOMI no Kane, were punished as playing an important role in the Court, in the following era of Emperor Tenmu, no official from the NAKATOMI (FUJIWARA) clan could assume a post in key areas of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because some influential officials who were from the same clan (the NAKATOMI clan) as Kamatari in the Omi Imperial Court such as NAKATOMI no Kane were punished as important figures in the Court, people from the NAKATOMI (FUJIWARA) clan were driven out of the inner circle of the Tenmu Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: However, because some influential officials who were from the same clan (the NAKATOMI clan) as Kamatari in the Omi Imperial Court such as NAKATOMI no Kane were punished as important figures in the Court, people from the NAKATOMI (FUJIWARA) clan were driven out of the inner circle of the Tenmu Imperial Court.

sen.j: よって、有力な後ろ盾を持たない不比等は下級官人からの立身を余儀なくされたと考えられている。
sen.e: Fuhito, therefore, lost any backing in the Court and had to start from a lower rank to establish himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Fuhito therefore lost the backing of powerful figures in the Court and had to start from a lower rank to establish himself.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Fuhito therefore lost the backing of powerful figures in the Court and had to start from a lower rank to establish himself.

sen.j: 草壁皇子の息子、697年軽皇子（文武天皇）の擁立に功績があり、その後見として政治の表舞台に出てくる。
sen.e: Having succeeded in helping Prince Karu (later Emperor Monmu), the son of Prince Kusakabe, to be enthroned in 697, Fuhito came out to be actively involved in politics as guardian of Prince Karu.
After having worked successfully for the enthronement of the Prince Karu (the Emperor Monmu), a son of the Prince Kusakabe, he appeared on the political scene as the guardian of the emperor.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: After having worked successfully for the enthronement of the Prince Karu (the Emperor Monmu), a son of the Prince Kusakabe, he appeared on the political scene as the guardian of the emperor.

sen.j: また後室の県犬養三千代の力添えにより、皇室との関係を深め、文武天皇に娘宮子を嫁がせ首皇子（聖武天皇）を産ませている。
sen.e: Also, with the support of Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo (later TACHIBANA no Michiyo), a dowager, Fuhito deepened the relations with Imperial family and made his daughter, Miyako, married to Emperor Monmu to give birth to Fuhito's grandson, Prince Obito (later Emperor Shomu).

With the support of Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo (later TACHIBANA no Michiyo), a dowager, Fuhito deepened the relations with the Imperial family and married off his daughter, Miyako, to the Emperor Monmu, to both of whom Fuhito's grandson, the Prince Obito (later Emperor Shomu), was born.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: With the support of Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo (later TACHIBANA no Michiyo), a dowager, Fuhito deepened the relations with the Imperial family and married off his daughter, Miyako, to the Emperor Monmu, to both of whom Fuhito's grandson, the Prince Obito (later Emperor Shomu), was born.

sen.j: さらに橘三千代との間の娘である光明子を聖武天皇に嫁がせた。
sen.e: Also, Fuhito succeeded in making his another daughter, Komyoshi, who was born to TACHIBANA no Michiyo, to be married to Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, Fuhito married off his another daughter, Komyoshi, who was born to TACHIBANA no Michiyo, to the Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, Fuhito married off his another daughter, Komyoshi, who was born to TACHIBANA no Michiyo, to the Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 光明子は不比等の死後、不比等の息子の藤原四兄弟の力によって光明皇后となり初の人臣皇后の例となった。
sen.e: Komyoshi was enthroned, after Fuhito died, as Empress Komyo with the help of the four sons of Fuhito and became known as the first subject to be Empress.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Fuhito died, Komyoshi was enthroned as the Empress Komyo with the help of Fujiwara four brothers, the sons of Fuhito, and became the first subject who turned into an empress.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正。「藤原四兄弟」は定訳があったので、採用しました。
sen.e: After Fuhito died, Komyoshi was enthroned as the Empress Komyo with the help of Fujiwara four brothers, the sons of Fuhito, and became the first subject who turned into an empress.

sen.j: 不比等は氏寺の山階寺を奈良に移し興福寺と改めた。
sen.e: Fuhito moved Yamashina-dera Temple, one of the Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory), to Nara and renamed it Kofuku-ji Temple.
Fuhito moved Yamashina-dera Temple, one of the Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory), to Nara and renamed it Kofuku-ji Temple.
Fuhito moved Yamashina-dera Temple, one of the Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory), to Nara and renamed it Kofuku-ji Temple.

sen.j: また、大宝律令の編纂にも関与、その後、養老律令の編纂作業に取りかかるが720年に病死、作業は中途する。
sen.e: Also, he was actively involved in compiling Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) and later Yoro Ritsuryo Code, but he died from a disease in 720 and the compilation work was halted.
Also, he was actively involved in compiling Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) and later Yoro Ritsuryo Code, but he died of an illness in 720 and the compilation work was halted.

sen.e: Also, he was actively involved in compiling Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) and later Yoro Ritsuryo Code, but he died of an illness in 720 and the compilation work was halted.

sen.j: 不比等とその息子の藤原四兄弟によって、藤原氏の繁栄の基礎が固められるとともに最初の黄金時代が作り上げられた。
sen.e: FUJIWARA's four brothers, the sons of Fuhito, built a strong foundation for the future prosperity as well as the first golden age of the FUJIWARA clan.
Fuhito and his sons (Fujiwara four brothers) built a strong foundation for the future prosperity, initiating the first golden age of the FUJIWARA clan.
